Key Match Events: An added-time goal from substitute Felicio Milson (24) gave Angola a shock 1-0 victory over Ghana in a 2025 Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON) qualifier in Kumasi on Thursday.
Pre-Game Insights: Ghana included six Premier League players in the starting lineup as they sought to atone for embarrassing group-stage exits from the 2022 and 2024 Cup of Nations tournaments.
Post-Match Reflections: Home supporters hurled dozens of plastic bottles onto the pitch after the final whistle to express their anger at the Group F matchday one result.
Miscellaneous Highlights: It was the first loss suffered by four-time African champions Ghana at the Baba Yara Stadium since 2000.
Others: Angola reached the 2024 Cup of Nations quarter-finals before bowing out to eventual runners-up Nigeria, and share the Group F lead with Sudan, who beat Niger 1-0 on Wednesday.
